metadata.description: The default name for the DCE is ms-sentinel-dce-[function-name]-[LA-Region]. If you prefer a custom name, please set this flag to true
Default name will be ms-sentinel-rawdata-dcr-[function-name]-[LA-Region], no need to enter if you want to use default names
Default name will be ms-sentinel-normdata-dcr-[function-name]-[LA-Region], no need to enter if you want to use default names

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp reflecting the time in which the event was generated.

columns.name: EventMessage
columns.description: A general message or description.

columns.name: EventCount
columns.description: This value is used when the source supports aggregation, and a single record may represent multiple events.

columns.name: EventStartTime
columns.description: The time in which the event started. If the source supports aggregation and the record represents multiple events, the time that the first event was generated. If not provided by the source record, this field aliases the TimeGenerated field.

columns.name: EventEndTime
columns.description: The time in which the event ended. If the source supports aggregation and the record represents multiple events, the time that the last event was generated. If not provided by the source record, this field aliases the TimeGenerated field.

columns.name: EventType
columns.description: The operation reported by the record.

columns.name: EventSubType
columns.description: Additional description of the event type, if applicable.

columns.name: EventResult
columns.description: The outcome of the event, represented by one of the following values: Success, Partial, Failure, NA (Not Applicable). The value may not be provided directly by the sources, in which case it is derived from other event fields, for example, the EventResultDetails field.

columns.name: EventResultDetails
columns.description: The HTTP status code.

columns.name: EventOriginalUid
columns.description: A unique ID of the original record, if provided by the source.

columns.name: EventOriginalType
columns.description: The original event type or ID, if provided by the source.

columns.name: EventOriginalSubType
columns.description: The original event subtype or ID, if provided by the source. For example, this field will be used to store the original Windows logon type. This value is used to derive EventSubType, which should have only one of the values documented for each schema.

columns.name: EventOriginalResultDetails
columns.description: The original result details provided by the source. This value is used to derive EventResultDetails, which should have only one of the values documented for each schema.

columns.name: EventSeverity
columns.description: The severity of the event. Valid values are: Informational, Low, Medium, or High.

columns.name: EventOriginalSeverity
columns.description: The original severity as provided by the reporting device. This value is used to derive EventSeverity.

columns.name: EventProduct
columns.description: The product generating the event.

columns.name: EventProductVersion
columns.description: The version of the product generating the event.

columns.name: EventVendor
columns.description: The vendor of the product generating the event.

columns.name: EventSchema
columns.description: The schema the event is normalized to. Each schema documents its schema name.

columns.name: EventSchemaVersion
columns.description: The version of the schema.

columns.name: EventReportUrl
columns.description: A URL provided in the event for a resource that provides more information about the event.

columns.name: EventOwner
columns.description: The owner of the event, which is usually the department or subsidiary in which it was generated.

columns.name: Dvc
columns.description: A unique identifier of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcIpAddr
columns.description: The IP address of the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcHostname
columns.description: The hostname of the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcDomain
columns.description: The domain of the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcDomainType
columns.description: The type of DvcDomain. Valid values include 'Windows' and 'FQDN'.

columns.name: DvcFQDN
columns.description: The hostname of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcDescription
columns.description: A descriptive text associated with the device.

columns.name: DvcId
columns.description: The unique ID of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcIdType
columns.description: The type of DvcId.

columns.name: DvcMacAddr
columns.description: The MAC address of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event. Example: 00:1B:44:11:3A:B7

columns.name: DvcZone
columns.description: The network on which the event occurred or which reported the event, depending on the schema.

columns.name: DvcOs
columns.description: The operating system running on the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcOsVersion
columns.description: The version of the operating system on the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcAction
columns.description: The action taken on the web session.

columns.name: DvcOriginalAction
columns.description: The original DvcAction as provided by the reporting device.

columns.name: DvcInterface
columns.description: The original DvcAction as provided by the reporting device.

columns.name: DvcScopeId
columns.description: The cloud platform scope ID the device belongs to. DvcScopeId map to a subscription ID on Azure and to an account ID on AWS.

columns.name: DvcScope
columns.description: The cloud platform scope the device belongs to. DvcScope map to a subscription ID on Azure and to an account ID on AWS.

columns.name: AdditionalFields
columns.description: Additional information, represented using key/value pairs provided by the source which do not map to ASim.

columns.name: TargetFileCreationTime
columns.description: The time at which the target file was created.

columns.name: TargetFileDirectory
columns.description: The target file folder or location.

columns.name: TargetFileExtension
columns.description: The target file extension.

columns.name: TargetFileMimeType
columns.description: The Mime or Media type of the target file.

columns.name: TargetFileName
columns.description: The name of the target file, without a path or a location, but with an extension if relevant.

columns.name: TargetFilePath
columns.description: The full, normalized path of the target file, including the folder or location, the file name, and the extension.

columns.name: TargetFilePathType
columns.description: The type of TargetFilePath.

columns.name: TargetFileMD5
columns.description: The MD5 hash of the target file.

columns.name: TargetFileSHA1
columns.description: The SHA-1 hash of the target file.

columns.name: TargetFileSHA256
columns.description: The SHA-256 hash of the target file.

columns.name: TargetFileSHA512
columns.description: The SHA-512 hash of the source file.

columns.name: HashType
columns.description: The type of hash stored in the Hash alias field.

columns.name: TargetFileSize
columns.description: The size of the target file in bytes.

columns.name: ActorUserIdType
columns.description: The type of the ID stored in the ActorUserId field.

columns.description: The Actor username, including domain information when available.

columns.description: Specifies the type of the user name stored in the ActorUsername field.

columns.name: ActorUserType
columns.description: The type of actor.

columns.description: The name of the acting process.

columns.description: The process ID (PID) of the acting process.

columns.name: HttpUserAgent
columns.description: When the operation is initiated using HTTP or HTTPS, the HTTP user agent header.

columns.name: NetworkApplicationProtocol
columns.description: When the operation is initiated by a remote system, the application layer protocol used by the connection or session.

columns.name: SrcIpAddr
columns.description: When the operation is initiated by a remote system, the IP address of this system.

columns.name: SrcGeoCountry
columns.description: The country associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoRegion
columns.description: The region within a country associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoCity
columns.description: The city associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoLatitude
columns.description: The latitude of the geographical coordinate associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoLongitude
columns.description: The longitude of the geographical coordinate associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: TargetAppName
columns.description: The name of the destination application.

columns.name: TargetAppId
columns.description: The ID of the destination application, as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: TargetAppType
columns.description: The type of the destination application.

columns.name: TargetUrl
columns.description: When the operation is initiated using HTTP or HTTPS, the URL used.

columns.name: RuleName
columns.description: The name or ID of the rule by associated with the inspection results.

columns.name: RuleNumber
columns.description: The number of the rule associated with the inspection results.

columns.name: ThreatId
columns.description: The ID of the threat or malware identified in the file activity.

columns.name: ThreatName
columns.description: The name of the threat or malware identified in the file activity.

columns.name: ThreatCategory
columns.description: The category of the threat or malware identified in the file activity.

columns.name: ThreatRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level associated with the identified threat. The level should be a number between 0 and 100.

columns.name: ThreatOriginalRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: ThreatFilePath
columns.description: A file path for which a threat was identified. The field ThreatField contains the name of the field ThreatFilePath represents.

columns.name: ThreatField
columns.description: The field for which a threat was identified. The value is either SrcFilePath or DstFilePath.

columns.name: ThreatConfidence
columns.description: The confidence level of the threat identified, normalized to a value between 0 and a 100.

columns.name: ThreatOriginalConfidence
columns.description: The original confidence level of the threat identified, as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: ThreatIsActive
columns.description: True ID the threat identified is considered an active threat.

columns.name: ThreatFirstReportedTime
columns.description: The first time the IP address or domain were identified as a threat.

columns.name: ThreatLastReportedTime
columns.description: The last time the IP address or domain were identified as a threat.

dataFlows.transformKql:
source
| extend eventDatetime = datetime_add('Millisecond', tolong(timestamp), todatetime('1970-01-01'))
| extend TimeGenerated = iff(isnotempty(eventDatetime), eventDatetime, now())
| project-rename 
        CrowdStrikeId = ['id']
| extend 
        timestamp = tolong(timestamp),
        ContextTimeStamp = todouble(ContextTimeStamp),        
        BoundingLimitCount = tolong(BoundingLimitCount),        
        RemotePort = tolong(RemotePort),
        LocalPort = tolong(LocalPort),
        InterfaceIndex = tolong(InterfaceIndex),
        NetLuidIndex = tolong(NetLuidIndex),
        RuleMatchCount = tolong(RuleMatchCount),
        RuleMatchCountSinceLastReport = tolong(RuleMatchCountSinceLastReport),
        AdditionalFields = todynamic(AdditionalFields)

| extend 
        timestamp = tolong(timestamp),

        BoundingLimitCount = tolong(BoundingLimitCount),
        DnsRequestCount = tolong(DnsRequestCount),
        InterfaceIndex = tolong(InterfaceIndex),
        AdditionalFields = todynamic(AdditionalFields)
